intro: Sida phyllanthos, commonly known as the silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in open areas such as roadsides and fields. Sida phyllanthos is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
